actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend title XII of the Organized Crime Control Act of 1970, and for other purposes.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues
subjects_top_term: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Establishes the National Commission on Individual Rights and Personal Security. Declares to be the duty of the Commission to conduct a comprehensive study and review of Federal court decisions, laws, and practices relating (1) to special grand juries, bail reform and preventive detention, no-knock search warrants, the accumulation of data on individuals by Federal agencies as authorized by law or acquired by executive action, and (2) the conduct of stop and frisk arrests, searches and seizures, interrogations, appellate review by the prosecution, lack of mutual pretrial criminal discovery, self-incrimination and prosecutor comment on failure to testify, the conduct of lineups, disclosure of informants' identies, fingerprinting and photography, and trial delay, finality and collateral review of Federal and State criminal proceedings. Requires final report from the Commission three years after the date of enactment of this Act.

titles.title: A bill to amend title XII of the Organized Crime Control Act of 1970, and for other purposes.
